name: Just Another Team's MnK rolls
description: Just Another Team's recommendations for weapons through seasons 4-16. Recommended for Mouse and Keyboard.

data.description: Of the 140 HCs, Waking has a lower base range at 38 therefore it cannot really be a max range weapon, however, it does have great base handling. Due to the inability to fight at the extended ranges of 140s, sight choice can come down to which is preferred visually. Despite this, the sights which are normally ignored because of the stat penalties they incur (Sureshot & Crossfire) can be worth it to push the range out as far as possible.
60 base reload + 10 from mag perk + 10/20/40 form vorpal would be sufficient for reloads. Outlaw would max out reload (+60) but its not as consistently proc’d in higher level content.

While no longer as powerful as it used to be, Felwinters is still a guaranteed excellent roll on a still competitive shotgun frame in PvP. Surplus has become even less useful with the ability nerf, so personally I’d go all in on consistency and run Slideshot + Opening Shot. There are much better shotguns for PvE, but Felwinters does have a consistent roll with at least a good damage perk if you have nothing better.

Opening Shot is arguably the best in slot perk. Rangefinder is generally the go to (it does add ~3M of base range) but Hawkmoon is a run and gun weapon (in my opinion) - if you want range, run a 120 or Luna Faction boots. Opening Shot gives a serious bonus to accuracy on ground and in air and helps guarantee landing the first crit (or 7 stack OHKO if you wait for perk to reset). Moving Target is nearly worthless due to high base AA stat.

The medium zoom scopes add +3 / 4 to zoom which has a massive impact on damage drop off. Model 8 Red pushes it to 17 zoom which makes this the best in slot SMG by a long shot (get it? Because it has more range?) pushing a 60 stat SMG to 20M base range.

The medium zoom scopes add +3 / 4 to zoom which has a massive impact on damage drop off. Model 8 Red pushes it to 17 zoom which makes this the best in slot SMG by a long shot (get it? Because it has more range?) pushing a 60 stat SMG to 20M base range. Deciding between Kill Clip and Iron Reach comes down to deciding what you want your smg to be. Iron Reach gives it an extra 3m of range (and with smgs, every metre counts) making it a better dueling weapon, while Kill Clip’s damage buff gives it a nutty ttk and an excellent snowball machine.

Frenzy is +50 to reload, so that perk alone puts Fatebringer at max reload speed. Loader will still add a scalar so it will be faster. Kill Clip does not boost Explosive Payload damage, just the impact damage. Explosive sometimes interferes with Firefly explosions.

Kill Clip does not improve TTK - just forgiveness and effective range. Opening Shot is still likely the best in slot, but do not sleep on Eye of the Storm for a mid-duel consistency boost, because of its mid-combat proc condition often occuring during 1v1 duels, the accuracy bump EotS grants could be excellent for finishing a fight.

Choosing between Reservoir Burst and HIR in PvE depends on the situation. HIR for boss damage and Reservoir Burst for general use and add clear. HIR is the clear winner for PvP, since it reduces the bolts needed for a kill while procced, and one stack of Heating Up makes the recoil perfectly vertical for easier bolt control.

In PvP Eyasluna does not reach the same ranges that Adept Fate can, while still “wasting” a perk slot on Rangefinder. However this allows it to reach into more interesting builds while not focusing wholly on range. If you prefer the feel of Eyasluna then a Rangefinder + Moving Target roll is the play for the range, but Unrelenting is a surprisingly good 6s perk, while Demo can be used to better use your now slower charging grenades.

The God Combo of Quickdraw + Snapshot returns on a 90 rpm sniper. Personally I’d go all in on Handling with a Qd + Snap sniper, to help with the stow speed and attempt to match the old version of Quickdraw as closely as possible (potentially even using Quick Access Sling if you can justify the loss of the option of air shots. Despite the return of the old combo, don’t discount Firmly Planted as an excellent accuracy booster when crouching.

The crafted version of this weapon can get Enhanced Overflow, which when combined with Extended Mag can get a 16 round mag in PvE. This pairs extremely well with an Auto Loading Heavy weapon if you want to use an exotic primary, or even just as an alternative to a Triple Tap sniper to eliminate reload time (note, Triple Tap is still superior to Overflow if you hit all crits thanks to pulling ammo from thin air instead of taking from reserves)

While Under Your Skin rolls the classic combo of Archers Tempo + Explosive Head, it might be worth for some people to forgo the slight damage increase of Explosive and instead go for an Adaptive Munitions roll. This perk allows the bow to essentially ignore Match Game, as it gives an eventual 600% damage increase against non-Void elemental shields. With an Adaptive Munitions roll, you could theoretically delete all other elemental bows and only use an Under Your Skin god roll and still be just as effective. An excellent vault cleaning roll.

Smallbore and Accurized work together to reach 60 range, important for the consistent ohk range of 6-7m on Aggressive frames. As the only Kinetic Aggressive shotgun with Elemental Capacitor, this rules the slot on an Arc subclass. However being able to keep Frenzy procc’d through constant combat in 6s or peakshooting and other chip damage methods would give a huge boost to handling and an excellent damage buff for defensive shotgunning. My personal take is for Ele cap and use a different shotgun on Arc, but if you can keep Frenzy running in those important moments this shotgun can bis for all subclasses.

This handcannon is stacked with good PvP perks, and there very nearly isn’t a bad perk combination on the weapon. The suggested EotS + Opening Shot roll is excellent for 1 on 1 dueling, giving accuracy boosts at practically every part of the gunfight, but it’s not alone at the top. Some other suggested perk combinations; EotS + Rangefinder to duel at 35m, HFG + Opening Shot for closer range primary, Compulsive Reloader + Moving Target to reduce flinch and improve passive aa as much as possible, the possibilities are tremendous. Cantana has a low recoil direction of 85 (hand canons have a floor of 80) so arrowhead would be a best in slot pick.

Despite it’s low damage, it rolls with Demo + Wellspring for ability builds, and Adaptive Munitions + Dbreak/Turnabout for shield breaking, but I wouldn’t use it over other pulse rifles that deal more base damage in more difficult content like GMs or Master Raids.

This handcannon is stacked with good PvP perks, and there very nearly isn’t a bad perk combination on the weapon. The suggested EotS + Opening Shot roll is excellent for 1 on 1 dueling, giving accuracy boosts at practically every part of the gunfight, but it’s not alone at the top. Some other suggested perk combinations; EotS + Rangefinder to duel at 35m, HFG + Opening Shot for closer range primary, Compulsive Reloader + Moving Target to reduce flinch and improve passive aa as much as possible, the possibilities are tremendous. Cantana has a low recoil direction of 85 (hand canons have a floor of 80) so arrowhead would be a best in slot pick.

It’s slightly let down by not being able to reach 100 recoil direction, but hitting 98 with Arrowhead Break and a Counterbalance Mod is good enough. Field Prep/ALH + Vorpal makes it an excellent dps Fusion in the Kinetic slot.

The first non-sunset Adaptive smg to return to the game, Hero’s Burden poses an interesting question. Can you deal with 10 stability (0 if you lack Ricochet) and the massive flinch that grants in order to achieve one of the longest ranges an smg can get? If yes, then go all in on Range with Full Bore and Iron Reach. If no, then you’ve still got a solid option with Hammer forged and Kill Clip that is let down by it’s mediocre 3rd column and 14 zoom

Move over Empirical Evidence and Brass Attacks, Breachlight has a true successor. Rolling many of the perks and combos that made Breachlight such a powerhouse, with a few new perks thrown in for good measure. Demo in the 3rd column along with the option of Subsistence to be combined with a damage perk in MKC or Adrenaline Junkie will let this shine in PvE.

A unique GL, in that every single shot proc’s Chill Clip and applies 50 stacks of slow. Slow one enemy with a direct hit, and blind everyone around it with Blinding nades. Note that Chill Clip does not proc at all if Ambitious Assassin is the chosen perk, so avoid it and Proximity Nades (Which prevent the grenade from direct hitting at all) if you want to freeze enemies.

A rare PvP fusion that rolls with Rangefinder, putting it as the Adaptive version of Loaded Question for its slightly deeper ohk kills than others of its archetypes. Liquid Coils is an option for ohk at 5 bolts on all resiliences. Controller users are better off maximizing range for fusions in PvP, so a roll with Hammer Forged + Projection Fuse is more worthwhile

Another Void 750, but this blows The Title out of the water with its wide selection of perks. 3rd column Best In Slot is easily Demo, but this can be paired well with practically any final column damage perk. Frenzy for a consistent damage increase, Golden Tricorn for the largest damage increase after fully proccing the perk (Demo helps grenade uptime just for this) Rampage for a classic. Don’t knock Repulsor Brace for a full Void build to assist survivability with relatively consistent 45hp Void Overshields

Thanks to the Desperado nerf, this pulse lacks the killing power of Messenger with Kill Clip, or even NTTE with the perk proc’d. While the relatively poor feel of the gun when stacked up against its direct competitors in the slot stops this pulse from being among the greats, it still has enough going for it to make it a solid enough option if you can't access Messenger or don’t want to run an exotic

A High Impact MG worth getting for PvE. The return of Killing Tally allows this MG to put in excellent work clearing ads when combined with the 40% s16 MG buff against non-boss enemies. This is the current pick for a Solar MG in GMs, whether that’s with Incandescent to pair with a Solar 3.0 build, or with Killing Tally to enhance its add clearing power
